newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean 3-yr yields close lower, CDs flat.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean 3-yr yields close lower, CDs flat.

text.p: Yields on three-year benchmark corporate bonds ended lower on Thursday on brisk buying despite the central bank's liquidity tightening measure and relatively large new issues, brokers said.
The central Bank of Korea absorbed 1.3 trillion won from the banking system by issuing repurchase agreements (Repos) maturing on May 12.
* Overnight average call rates at 13.17 vs 13.28
However, the central bank's tightening move dampened the bullish sentiment.
Brokers said new issues were estimated at 179 billion won on Thursday compared with 47.5 billion won on Wednesday.
Three-month certificate of deposit (CD) yields finished flat for the third day in a row in dull trading.
